article_title: What Time Do Polls Close in Utah?
article_text:
Polls in Utah close at 6pm for Democrats and 7pm Mountain time for Republicans (8pm/9pm Eastern time). Utah is also offering online voting for Republicans for the first time. Online voting ends at 11pm Mountain time.

Utah is a closed caucus state. There are 40 delegates, awarded proportionally to GOP candidates winning more than 15 percent. Any candidate who wins a majority of voters gets all the delegates. There are 33 delegates, awarded proportionally, up for grabs in the Democrat primary.

article_metadata.author: Jason Hopkins

article_summary:
Polls in Utah close at 6pm for Democrats and 7pm Mountain time for Republicans (8pm/9pm Eastern time).
There are 33 delegates, awarded proportionally, up for grabs in the Democrat primary.
Utah is also offering online voting for Republicans for the first time.
There are 40 delegates, awarded proportionally to GOP candidates winning more than 15 percent.
Online voting ends at 11pm Mountain time.
